TRUST

BHARTIYA BRAHMIN CHARITABLE TRUST

Bhagwan Parshuram Institute of Technology (BPIT) has been promoted by the Bhartiya Brahmin Charitable Trust (BBCT), which was established in the year 1974. BBCT has about 380 trustees from various walks of life including several educationalists, industrialists, businessmen, architects, engineers, other professionals and also some philanthropists. The trust is constantly involved in several charitable programmes including professional education, health and upliftment of the poor.
Industrialist Shri Atam Prakash Kaushik, who is actively involved with the trust since its inception, is the President of the trust and Chairman of BPIT.
THE CHAIRMAN Sh. ATAM PRAKASH KAUSHIK

Sh. Atam Prakash Kaushik is the President of Bhartiya Brahmin Charitable Trust (BBCT) and also the founder Chairman of Bhagwan Parshuram Institute of Technology (founded by BBCT in 2005). He is one of the five members, who formed the Bhartiya Brahmin Charitable Trust (BBCT) about 44 years ago. He is an industrialist by profession and philanthropist by nature. He is a well-known figure in the social circles of Delhi. He is involved in the management of various other organisations performing social service to humankind. He is also a trustee of the Maharaja Agarsen Hospital and an Associate Member of Sant Parmanand Hospital. He holds several important honorary offices like the Chairman of Hindustan Mercantile, Association Dispute Committee; Member of Managing Committee of internationally known Shri Gauri Shankar Temple, Chandni Chowk; Member of Managing Committee of Sanskrit Vidyalaya, Ram Dal, Dariba; etc. For many years, he has also remained President of Janta College Bawal (Haryana).
